text: NF-kappa B / Rel family members regulating the <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in monocytic THP-1 cells .

A kappa B-site was identified in the promoter of the <extra_id_0> intercellular adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene , which is involved in regulation of <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression by <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and glucocorticoids .

text: We now report on the transcription factors which bind and transactivate this enhancer sequence .

In vitro , the <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B site appeared to bind <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> homodimers as well as heterodimers with <extra_id_0> NF-kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but weakly <extra_id_0> NF-kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> homodimers .

text: In addition , both <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not <extra_id_0> NF-kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , were shown to transactivate an <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B-reporter construct .

In monocytic THP-1 cells <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced two nuclear complexes which in vitro bound to the <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B site .

Using antibodies in an electrophoretic mobility supershift assay , one of these complexes was shown to contain <extra_id_0> NF-kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and to bind with higher affinity to the consensus kappa B site in the HIV long terminal repeat .

The second complex contained <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and exhibited higher affinity towards the <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kappa B than to the HIV kappa B site .

The <extra_id_0> glucocorticoid receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was shown to repress activity of both the <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> homodimer and the <extra_id_0> NF-kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimer .
